Situation1: Celebrate each other's achievements and milestones.
Situation2: A winter storm is slowing traffic while the passenger must catch an international flight
Story: The snow was coming down harder than I’d seen all winter, swirling in thick sheets across the windshield. My phone buzzed in the cupholder—my sister’s name flashed on the screen. She was waiting at our parents’ house, expecting me to show up for her graduation dinner, the one we’d all been planning for weeks. I could almost hear her laughter, see the proud smile on her face. But in the back seat, my passenger was anxiously checking his watch, his suitcase wedged between his knees. He told me twice already: his flight to Tokyo was the last one out before the airport shut down. As a brother, I wanted nothing more than to be there for my sister, to celebrate her big day. But as a taxi driver, I was responsible for getting this man to the airport safely and on time, no matter how treacherous the roads. My hands tightened on the steering wheel, heart pounding as I weighed the expectations pressing in from both sides, the storm outside nothing compared to the one inside me.
